commit 89d067d2e7c87ed1b380730e1cebcc89c4a50185
Author: Jo Geraerts <jo@umask.net>
Date:   Thu Aug 22 15:54:54 2019 +0200

    use ThreadLocalRandom instead of Random
    
    I was using The ReservoirItemsSketch in a multithreaded program.
    After replacing the normal java.util.Random by ThreadLocalRandom
    I had a significant improvement in performance.

 .../java/com/yahoo/sketches/sampling/ReservoirItemsSketch.java |  4 ++--

commit 8632249b7f95d1a0a60da10a72102eb10b581c8c
Author: Lee Rhodes <lrhodes@yahoo-inc.com>
Date:   Sat Feb 4 13:19:59 2017 -0800

    Comprehensive changes to quantiles, some Memory changes.
    
    Fixed a subtle bug in quantiles that could have affected accuracy.
    Refactored the code so that similar functions are in the same class.
    Redesigned updates for Direct quantile sketches to be directly in
    Memory. Direct Union operations remain on-heap for now.
    
    Changed MemoryRegion to be immutable. The only place it was used was one
    place in Tuple Sketches.
    
    Improved testing and documention (in the test hierarchy) of how to use
    the new MemoryUtil.memoryRequestHandler and examples of simple Memory
    Managers that utilize the MemoryRequest interface.
    
    Added a number of unit tests to improve coverage.
    
    Improved documentation where I found ambiguous or incomplete language.

 memory/src/main/java/com/yahoo/memory/Memory.java  |   4 +-

      Moved 4 constants into Util for better leverage.
    memory.AllocMemory
      added two new constructors: Reallocate and Allocate, Copy and Clear.
    memory.MemoryRegion
      formatting changes
    memory.MemoryRequest
      added new callback method for allocate, copy and clear
    memory.NativeMemory:
      added code comment
    theta.AnotB
      updated javadoc
    theta.DirectIntersection
      extensive changes to simplify the implementation of the state machine,
    changed method name.
      Removed deprecated constructor.
    theta.DirectQuickSelectSketch
      moderate changes: added code docs, javadocs, moved constants to Util,
    more consistent use of special set methods.
    theta.HashOperations
      minor code formatting, javadoc updates
    theta.HeapAlphaSketch
      updated use of constants now in Util.
      cleaned up getRetainedEntries logic.
    theta.HeapAnotB
      added code comments, changed method name
    theta.HeapIntersection
      extensive changes to simplify the implementation of the state machine
    and make consistent with DirectIntersection.
      Changed method name. Removed deprecated constructor.
    theta.HeapQuickSelectSketch
      moved constants to Util
    theta.SetOperation
      moved constants to Util, code formatting, eliminated method, renamed
    method.
    theta.SetOperationBuilder
      changed method signature.
      Removed call to deprecated Intersection and AnotB constructors.
    theta.Union
      Eliminated unnecessary "public" from interface methods.
      Added missing rebuild() to interface.
    theta.UnionImpl
      Reordered methods, Added code comments, some variable renaming for
    clarity
    
    Test hierarchy: added some additional tests.

 1 file changed, 1 deletion(-)

commit a7fc0a776c619807d1af101ef18f76b480dd7a0b
Author: Eric Tschetter <cheddar@yahoo-inc.com>
Date:   Wed Nov 25 09:13:24 2015 -0800

    Remove self from @author tags
    
    Author tags don't provide any significant information.  Over the lifetime of a project, code lines will be changed by various different individuals, knowing the original author of a file often doesn't actually tell you anything about who is currently maintaining it or who most recently touched it.  If you want to know who to thank/blame for some lines of code, using your SCM's "blame" mechanism is the right way to get that information.

commit 308295e6a41e9be64e011444a02acd5216e9ea4a
Author: Eric Tschetter <cheddar@yahoo-inc.com>
Date:   Fri Aug 7 22:12:47 2015 -0700

    OnHeapCompressedFields
    
    These are a loss-less compressed form of an HLL.  It uses 4-bit compression along with an exceptions list to store values that are larger than what can represented by 4 bits.

Author: Lee Rhodes <lrhodes@yahoo-inc.com>
Date:   Mon Sep 14 11:42:48 2015 -0700

    Bug fix: HllSketch without HIP bounds calculations were way off.
    The HllSketch eps() method was using the HIP_REL_ERROR_NUMER =
    0.836083874576235 constant
    instead of HLL_REL_ERROR_NUMER = 1.04.  These are correctly used in
    Kevin's C code, but incorrect in Alex's HLL java code and everthing
    since. I am fixing it here but nowhere else.

commit e712486d926b39b580a8be8f47a3c84cbced05a8
Author: Lee Rhodes <lrhodes@yahoo-inc.com>
Date:   Sun Jul 19 18:12:18 2015 -0700

    Created new method in Union Interface that accepts a Mem reference
    directly.  This bypasses the need to heapify or wrap to create a sketch
    object before unioning.  This mem object MUST be a compact-ordered
    sketch, or a SetSketch from V2 or V3. My light testing says it should
    work.
